guiSET.core

Class Container

  • java.lang.Object
    • guiSET.core.Control
      • guiSET.core.TextBased
        • guiSET.core.Container
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlowContainer, Frame, HFlowContainer, ScrollArea, VFlowContainer

    public class Container
extends TextBased
    Base class for all containers. Containers group items and can be nested to create complex graphics structures.
    Author:
    Mc-Zen

        public Container()
        Default constructor sets width and height to 100

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(Control... items)
        Add items to Container. Containers that don't layout their items automatically like i.e. VFlowContainer or VScrollContainer sort them by z-index!
        Parameters:
        items - arbitrary number of items.

      • insert

        public void insert(int position,
                   Control... items)
        Insert items at given index position.
        Parameters:
        position - index to insert items into list.
        items - arbitrary number of items.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Remove all items.

      • remove

        public Control remove(int index)
        Remove item at position in item list. Throws error if index is bad.
        Parameters:
        index - position
        Returns:
        returns the removed item

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Control item)
        Remove a specific item from item list.
        Parameters:
        item - item to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the item has actually been removed

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf(Control item)
        Get list index of given item. Returns -1 if item is no child of this container.
        Parameters:
        item - item to get index to
        Returns:
        index

      • getItems

        public Control[] getItems()
        Retrieve all items as Control array.
        Returns:
        array of items

      • getItem

        public Control getItem(int index)
        Get item in item list at given index. Throws error if index exceeds list length.
        Parameters:
        index - index of requested item
        Returns:
        item

      • getNumItems

        public int getNumItems()
        Get number of items.
        Returns:
        number of items

      • sortItems

        public void sortItems(java.util.Comparator<Control> comp)
        Sort items providing a Comparator.
        Parameters:
        comp - Comparator

      • fitContent

        public void fitContent()
        Resize container once so it fits its content.

      • traceRelativeCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Control> traceRelativeCoordinates(int x,
                                                             int y)
        Get a list of arbitrarly nested child elements that given coordinates go through, ordered by layer on the screen. This version takes relative coordinates of this object. Invisible and disabled elements are ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate on this element
        y - y coordinate on this element
        Returns:
        list of traces elements

      • traceAbsoluteCoordinates

        public java.util.ArrayList<Control> traceAbsoluteCoordinates(int x,
                                                             int y)
        Get a list of arbitrarly nested child elements that given coordinates go through, ordered by layer on the screen. This version takes absolute window coordinates. Invisible and disabled elements are ignored.
        Parameters:
        x - absolute x window coordinate
        y - absolute y window coordinate
        Returns:
        list of traces elements
